values.description:
Previously, Sensor::lastUpdateTime was being checked to throttle sensor updates, but it was left to each sensors UpdateImpl function to set this value. This was causing the ContactSensor and RFIDSensor to not obey the specified update rate, since they didn't set this value.

Now, lastUpdateTime is set within the Sensor::Update function so that all sensors will obey the update rate, and a new variable lastMeasurementTime was added so that each sensor's UpdateImpl function can specify the time at which the measurement was recorded.
values.title: Sensor update rate and measurement timing

summary.raw:
Previously, Sensor::lastUpdateTime was being checked to throttle sensor updates, but it was left to each sensors UpdateImpl function to set this value. This was causing the ContactSensor and RFIDSensor to not obey the specified update rate, since they didn't set this value.

Now, lastUpdateTime is set within the Sensor::Update function so that all sensors will obey the update rate, and a new variable lastMeasurementTime was added so that each sensor's UpdateImpl function can specify the time at which the measurement was recorded.
summary.html:
Previously, Sensor::lastUpdateTime was being checked to throttle sensor updates, but it was left to each sensors UpdateImpl function to set this value. This was causing the ContactSensor and RFIDSensor to not obey the specified update rate, since they didn't set this value.

Now, lastUpdateTime is set within the Sensor::Update function so that all sensors will obey the update rate, and a new variable lastMeasurementTime was added so that each sensor's UpdateImpl function can specify the time at which the measurement was recorded.

values.description:
Made a few fixes after experimenting with deferred rendering.

Selection buffer currently does not work in deferred rendering mode, see issue #237. A try-catch block is temporarily added to catch exceptions thrown by SelectionBuffer's render texture update() call so further work can be carried out on deferred rendering. Need to come back to this issue later.
values.title: Deferred rendering fixes and selection buffer code refactoring

summary.raw:
Made a few fixes after experimenting with deferred rendering.

Selection buffer currently does not work in deferred rendering mode, see issue #237. A try-catch block is temporarily added to catch exceptions thrown by SelectionBuffer's render texture update() call so further work can be carried out on deferred rendering. Need to come back to this issue later.
summary.html:
Made a few fixes after experimenting with deferred rendering.

Selection buffer currently does not work in deferred rendering mode, see issue #237. A try-catch block is temporarily added to catch exceptions thrown by SelectionBuffer's render texture update() call so further work can be carried out on deferred rendering. Need to come back to this issue later.

values.description:
fix the problem with busy wait trying to SetPaued in World.cc.

previously, cpu usage drops only when physics update_rate has been reduced, but sleep was bypassed when paused.

sleepOffset was running away negatively on some machines.
values.title: fix cpu usage during pause

summary.raw:
fix the problem with busy wait trying to SetPaued in World.cc.

previously, cpu usage drops only when physics update_rate has been reduced, but sleep was bypassed when paused.

sleepOffset was running away negatively on some machines.
summary.html:
fix the problem with busy wait trying to SetPaued in World.cc.

previously, cpu usage drops only when physics update_rate has been reduced, but sleep was bypassed when paused.

sleepOffset was running away negatively on some machines.

values.description:
Changed the name of the root element for SDF from <gazebo version="blah"> to <sdf version="blah">

This maintains backward compatibility, in that sdf v 1.3 will be able to read older sdf files.

Note: There are a lot of new .sdf files in the sdf/1.3 subdirectory. These are direct copies from version 1.2 of sdf.
values.title: Made SDF 1.3

summary.raw:
Changed the name of the root element for SDF from <gazebo version="blah"> to <sdf version="blah">

This maintains backward compatibility, in that sdf v 1.3 will be able to read older sdf files.

Note: There are a lot of new .sdf files in the sdf/1.3 subdirectory. These are direct copies from version 1.2 of sdf.
summary.html:
Changed the name of the root element for SDF from <gazebo version="blah"> to <sdf version="blah">

This maintains backward compatibility, in that sdf v 1.3 will be able to read older sdf files.

Note: There are a lot of new .sdf files in the sdf/1.3 subdirectory. These are direct copies from version 1.2 of sdf.

values.description:
This pull request has two main aspects:

- Add time to contacts message (note contacts message contains multiple contact messages). This serves as a timestamp for contact sensor readings.

- Fix a bug [(part of Issue 141)](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/141) with contact sensor where it was continuing to send messages even after losing contact with an object.

Two minor things:

- Add a comment about contactFeedbackIndex

- Prevent ODEPhysics from sending empty contacts messages
values.title: Time in contacts message, another contact sensor fix

summary.raw:
This pull request has two main aspects:

- Add time to contacts message (note contacts message contains multiple contact messages). This serves as a timestamp for contact sensor readings.

- Fix a bug [(part of Issue 141)](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/141) with contact sensor where it was continuing to send messages even after losing contact with an object.

Two minor things:

- Add a comment about contactFeedbackIndex

- Prevent ODEPhysics from sending empty contacts messages
summary.html:
This pull request has two main aspects:

  • Add time to contacts message (note contacts message contains multiple contact messages). This serves as a timestamp for contact sensor readings.

  • Fix a bug (part of Issue 141) with contact sensor where it was continuing to send messages even after losing contact with an object.

Two minor things:

  • Add a comment about contactFeedbackIndex

  • Prevent ODEPhysics from sending empty contacts messages
